alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Butler (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:30PM EST until February 19 at 8:31AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Beaver and Butler. Portions of the northern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following county, Hancock. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cranberry, Weirton, Butler, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Economy, Ellwood City, Ambridge, Homeacre-Lyndora, New Brighton, Shanor-Northvue, Beaver, Baden, Meridian, Zelienople, Rochester, Ohioville, Harmony Township and Meadowood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
